name: Introduction to Popular Culture
description: This course is an introduction to the study of popular culture and its impact on culture and society. It focuses on the history and evolution of popular culture, the impact of mass media, and the role of consumerism in shaping popular culture.

name: History of Popular Culture
description: This course focuses on the development of popular culture and its impact on the culture and society. It covers the major historical movements and ideologies that have shaped and influenced popular culture, as well as the role of mass media and consumerism in creating and sustaining popular culture.

name: Seminar on Popular Culture
description: This seminar course focuses on the analysis of popular culture from a cultural studies perspective. It addresses topics such as the representation of gender, race, and class in popular culture, the role of consumerism in popular culture, and the impact of popular culture on the media and society.

name: Advanced Seminar on Popular Culture
description: This advanced seminar course focuses on the analysis of popular culture from a cultural studies perspective. It addresses topics such as the intersection of popular culture and identity, the role of popular culture in creating and sustaining ideologies, and the role of popular culture in the formation of public opinion and discourse.
